thread.title: More: FAA confirms 4 people injured, 2 transported with critical burns, after small plane crashed in Henderson, Nev. - @8NewsNow

author: Jillian Stampher
title: More: FAA confirms 4 people injured, 2 transported with critical burns, after small plane crashed in Henderson, Nev. - @8NewsNow
text:
Piper PA 28 plane crashes in Henderson 
By Jonathan Cisowski | jcisowski@8newsnow.com 
Published 07/19 2015 02:44PM 
Updated 07/20 2015 08:26AM Copyright 2015 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Henderson, NV. 
A single-engine Piper PA 28 crashed around 1:30 p.m. Sunday afternoon in Henderson injuring four people. 
According to Henderson officials, the plane went down in a desert area southeast of Anthem and south of the Inspirada neighborhood. 
Four people were transported to University Medical Center. Two occupants suffered critical burns while the other two sustained non-life threatening injuries. 
Ian Gregor with the FAA said the plane was departing from Henderson Executive Airport when it crashed and caught fire. 
FAA investigators along with the NTSB are on scene investigating the cause of the crash.
